title: Deaver 2012 Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This very ripe and full-bodied wine has aromas like vanilla and baking spices, sweet cherry flavors and a smooth and rounded texture. A luscious cherry-pie impression lingers on the finish.

title: Dobbes Family Estate 2015 Crater View Vineyard Grenache Blanc (Rogue Valley)
description: Joe Dobbes pioneered this variety in Oregon, and it's a rare but welcome addition to the growing pantheon of food-friendly white wines. Light flavors of lemon and citrus touch gently on peach and mango, buoyed with fresh, crisp acidity. Not as dense as past vintages, but deliciously elegant.

title: Domaine Arnoux Père et Fils 2014 Les Beaumonts  (Chorey-lès-Beaune)
description: Aged in wood, this wine is ripe, with a smoky character from the toastiness. Next to the spice, the red currant and berry fruits are intensely fresh and disclose a tight line of acidity. The wine is still young, although developing well as the acidity softens. It will be ready to drink from 2018.

title: Vinoterra 2014 Saperavi (Kakheti)
description: This wine has a bouquet of black cherry, oregano and lavender. Flavors of cherry, cranberry, thyme, mocha and leather are supported by strong but smooth tannins, and the finish is equal parts savory and tart.

title: SonVida 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Lifted, floral blueberry, raspberry, tomato and herbal aromas set this apart from the norm. Fresh but limited on the palate, this tastes of herbal raspberry and savory meat. Similar to the palate, this is short on the finish, with pronounced oak.

title: St Hallett 2014 Poacher's Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc-Riesling White (Barossa)
description: This is clean, refreshing white blend at a realistic price. Grapefruit and fig aromas lead the way, followed by a plump mouthfeel and flavors of ripe fruit. Drink now.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Andreza Touriga Nacional-Touriga Franca Red (Douro)
description: Ripe and bold, this is a rich wine whose dense fruit is balanced by its equally dense tannins. It has spice, juicy black fruits and a structure that emphasizes minerality and oak aging. It's not quite ready, so drink from 2017.

title: Yves Giroux 2014 Les Raidillons  (Pouilly-Fuissé)
description: This wine is still firm, only hinting at its potential. The weight is there as well as the rich fruitiness. Give this wine a few months to bring out the generous fruit and texture. Drink from 2017.

title: Viña Alicia 2008 Coleccion de Familia Nebbiolo (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Smoky and rustic upfront, this mature Nebbiolo smells of cherry, cassis and wet cement. In the mouth, this is a bit heavy and syrupy, with grabby tannins and an overall sticky feel. Ripe, candied berry, cocoa and oaky flavors flatten out and turn chocolaty on the finish.

title: Terra Bella 2011 Proprietary Red (Chalk Hill)
description: This Sonoma County wine made by Santa Barbara-based Winemaker Andrew Murray is explosively juicy in black currant and berry, while offering soft, lean aspects of herb and pepper.

title: The Divining Rod 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Marc Mondavi, who is the eldest son of the late Peter Mondavi, has a reputation as a bona fide water witch, hence the name of his wine project. This is his first venture into Oregon, and it's a welcome addition to the growing ranks of value Pinots from the Willamette Valley. Elegant and affordable, it's loaded with soft, accessible cherry and chocolate flavors, smooth as silk.

title: TintoNegro 2013 Finca La Escuela La Arena Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Saucy, woody aromas of plum and berry are good but strained. This smacks down with high acidity and a sense of tomato. Salty flavors of tomato, herbs, red plum and currant remain salty on the finish.

title: Schuchmann Wines 2014 Pirosmani Saperavi (Kakheti)
description: This semi-dry Saperavi offers a bouquet of blueberry, geranium leaf and white chocolate. It is well-rounded on the palate, with flavors of blackberry, strawberry, anise, chocolate and violet. Strong tannins do not overtake the sense of brightness that remains on the tongue from entry to finish.

title: Shumi Winery 2013 Tsinandali White (Kakheti)
description: A blend of Rkatsiteli and Mtsvane, this light-straw-colored wine has aromas of peach and freesia. It is very soft on the palate, with refreshing flavors of melon, clementine and passion fruit. The citrus finish offers a surprising touch of white chocolate.

title: Sidewood 2014 Pinot Gris (Adelaide Hills)
description: A solid all-around effort, this starts off with hints of struck match and citrus custard, then moves through apple and mandarin flavors. It's medium in body, with a refreshing finish and decent length.

title: Quimay 2015 Chardonnay (Neuquén)
description: Honeyed, floral aromas include bright citrus accents. Fresh, fruity and powerful across the palate, this is a ripe and ready Chardonnay with strong orange and pineapple flavors. Additional citrus notes push the finish.

title: Quinta da Calçada 2015 Calçada Terroir Loureiro-Alvarinho White (Vinho Verde)
description: Predominantly Loureiro, this is rich, ripe wine. It has a sunny character, ripe with green plums and apples and lightly shot with acidity. It is aromatic, fresh and ready to drink.

title: Quinta do Passadouro NV Passadouro Porto Tawny Reserve  (Port)
description: This is a fresh and fruity wine, full of red fruits that are laced with raisins and prunes. The acidity cuts through the richness balancing the natural sweetness. It has an attractive crisp aftertaste.

title: Tortoise Creek 2013 Cherokee Lane Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This nicely rich and rounded wine smells like vanilla and toasted bread. The flavors are ripe and black-cherry-like, with a hint of chocolate and baking spices that comes from oak. It's medium bodied and easy to like.

title: Trenel Fils 2014  Mâcon-Villages
description: This wine is round and smooth, with attractive white-fruit flavors. The light acidity is more than compensated by the touch of toastiness and spice. With a juicy aftertaste, the wine is already very enjoyable.

title: Troon 2013 Blue Label Zinfandel (Applegate Valley)
description: This sports a blue label, to differentiate it from the winery's estate bottling. It's dark and toasty, with robust black-cherry fruit, along with strong notes of charcoal, espresso and vanilla. There's nothing subtle here, but should work well with Korean ribs.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Azul Portugal Red (Bairrada)
description: This is an attractive wine, dominated by the typical Baga grape from Bairrada. Its tannins are tamed and rounded out producing rich black fruits and fine balanced acidity. The wine is ready to drink, although it will be even better from 2017.

title: Z. Alexander Brown 2013 Uncaged Red (North Coast)
description: Wonderful blackberry and ripe grape flavors fill up this big but smooth new wine under country-music star Zac Brown's label. It has a very dark color, jammy aromas, rather sweet flavors and a velvety texture with enough tannin to keep it appetizing.

title: Zaca Mesa 2012 Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: The historic winery's most widely accessible bottling, this is a solid everyday sipper, showing concentrated olallieberry, black plum, violet and teriyaki aromas. The palate discloses blackberry and mint, with touches of pepper and lavender.

title: Willful 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Nicely textured strawberry fruit is featured here. It drinks almost like an especially rich rosé, fresh and simple, in a good way. There's a dash of bitter green in the finishing tannins.

title: Alex Gambal 2014  Bourgogne
description: This creamy, light and soft wine offers attractive acidity and a touch of citrus. It is fruity and brings a bright aftertaste. The wine with its light buttery character is ready to drink.

title: Alta Colina 2014 12 O'Clock High Viognier (Adelaida District)
description: This bottling is leveled by 10% Roussanne, and shows ripe yellow peach, honeydew melon, honeyed toast, pear custard and a slight cashew-like marzipan on the fairly dense nose. Rounded flavors of pear, melon, mango and honey dust comprise the palate.

title: Aveleda 2015 Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)
description: Ripe Alvarinho gives a wine that is rich as well as crisp and dry. This wine, with its hints of apricot as well as citrus fruits has a piercing line of acidity along with the tangy texture and ripe aftertaste. It is ready to drink.

title: Claudio Alario 2012 Sorano  (Barolo)
description: French oak, a whiff of exotic spice and a buttery note lead the nose. The oak-driven aromas follow through to the tannic palate together with licorice, roasted coffee bean and dried cherry.

title: Clos Venturi 2015 1769 Carcajolu (Vin de France)
description: Made from a grape that probably hails from the Somontano region of Spain (where it is known as Parraleta) this is a tight, stalky wine that has acidity and black currant fruit in abundance. Its tannins are more restrained than the fruit, allowing a light structure to hold up the juicy acidity and crisp aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
